analyzed: ya mtshan can thams cad la mi sdug pa'i 'bras bur grags pa gang yin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas mi dge bar gcig tu nges par gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / bdag mi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bskyed pa gang yin pa dang /

analyzed: rig sngags dang bkra shis dang ldan pa gang yin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa de dag chos kyi phyir byed pa ma yin no //

analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med par smra ba gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: What is the theory of the end and the beginning?üîΩHere, some ascetics and brahmins,

analyzed: bram ze kha cig /'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: on the basis of worldly meditative concentration,

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mtha' yod par 'du shes pa dang / mtha' med par 'du shes pa dang / gnyi gar 'du shes pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin par 'du shes pas gnas pa mdo nyid las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: The S≈´tra itself explains in detail the four ways of abiding in the notion that the world is finite, infinite, both, or neither.

analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa'i bar du de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o // 'dir yang gtan tshigs dang / gang zag ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul bzhin du @75a * //
translated: It is neither finite nor infinite.

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi mtha' tha mar chad par 'gyur ram / mi 'gyur snyam du yang dag par tshol bar byed do // gang gi tshe 'jig ba'i bskal ba rjes su dran pa de'i tshe ni mtha' yod ba'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chags pa'i bskal pa dran pa de'i tshe ni /

analyzed: mtha' med pa'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: yul rgya che ba'i mtha' yang dag par tshor ba na /

analyzed: thad kar ni thams cad du pha rol yang mthong ba de'i tshe 'og dang steng du ni mtha' yod pa'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //
translated: Then the idea of finitude arises with regard to the zenith and nadir,

analyzed: don gyi khyad par la ni ma yin te /

analyzed: mtha' yod pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes dang / mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //
translated: the idea of infinity arises when one considers the letter a as multiple.

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / ci 'jig pa'i bskal pa de'i tshu rol na /

analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba yod par 'dod dam /

analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod /

analyzed: gal te yod na ni /

analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod ces byar mi 'byung ngo //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: lha mi spong ba bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: lha mi spong ba bzhi po rnams te /

original: mdo nyid las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo nyid las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //

original: de dag kyang mngon par mtho ba'i lam dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / nges par legs pa'i lam sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam las dri ba dris na /

analyzed: bdag ni lha mi spong ba yin no snyam du dam bcas nas /
translated: one makes the assertion, ‚ÄúI do not reject gods and humans.‚Äù

analyzed: gang du 'chi ba med pa rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi dri ba dris pa /

analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin par der de dag dri ba dris pa rnams la /

analyzed: de la lta @75b mi spong ba gcig ni blo ma byang ba kho na'o //

analyzed: gsum pa ni blo byangs ba rnam par nges pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: bzhi pa ni shes ba zhan cing shin tu rmongs pa kho na'o //

original: de la dang po ni brdzun du smra bas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / mi shes pa yod pas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa'i phyir mi shes so zhes gsal bar lan 'debs par mi byed do //

translated: Among them, the first does not answer clearly, saying ‚ÄúI do not know,‚Äù because he fears and avoids lying and because he fears and avoids saying what he does not know.

original: gnyis pa ni rang gis rtogs pa la 'jigs pa yod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rang gis rtogs pa la 'jigs pa yod de /

analyzed: brgal zhing brtags pas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / brdzun du smra bas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / log par lta bas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa'i phyir bdag gis shes so zhes gsal bar lan 'debs par mi byed do //
translated: Because they fear and avoid the following: being questioned and examined, lying, and wrong views, they do not answer clearly, saying I know.

analyzed: gsum pa ni log par lta bas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / brdzun du smra bas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / brgal zhing brtags pas 'jigs shing 'dzem pa dang / bdag ni nges pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar lan 'debs par mi byed do //
translated: In the third, they fear and avoid the following: wrong views, lying, being questioned and examined, and they do not answer clearly, saying I am not certain.

original: de dag ni der gzhan dang gzhan du rlung skur bar byed pas tshig gis spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni der gzhan dang gzhan du rlung skur bar byed pas tshig gis spong bar byed do //
translated: In these three, they avoid by words, because they are blown about by others here and there.

original: bzhi pa ni brgal zhing brtags shing 'dzem pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni brgal zhing brtags shing 'dzem pa kho na ste /

analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i lam dang / nges par legs pa'i lam zhes yi ge tsam la yang /

analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mkhas pa'i phyir bdag ni shin tu rmongs so zhes gsal bar lan 'debs par mi byed do //

original: de ni gzhan kho na la kun dris nas /
analyzed: de ni gzhan kho na la kun dris nas /

analyzed: de dang mthun par byed pas tshig gis spong bar byed do //

translated: We have explained these answers in accordance with the Sutra, which says that the person who is afraid of the reasons, the person, and the answers, remains in the same place.

analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du 'di ltar phyir rgol ba rnams 'ongs na /
translated: When the opponents come, they think,üîΩWe will cover this up.

analyzed: der g-yogs bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems pa 'di ni 'dir lta bar gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de bas na smra ba 'di yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this answer is not reasonable.

original: rgyu med par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: de yang bsam gtan la brten pa dang / rtog ge la brten pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // ci'i phyir rtog ge la brten nas de ltar bdag dang 'jig @76a * //

translated: because of the appearance of immeasurable, various internal and external things without prior intention, sometimes causes appear without effect, sometimes a wind blows suddenly and sometimes it does not,

original: res 'ga' glo bur du chu klung 'bab la /
analyzed: res 'ga' glo bur du chu klung 'bab la /
translated: sometimes a river flows suddenly and

analyzed: 'on te bdag rjes su dran /

analyzed: gal te rgyu yod na ni /

analyzed: des na bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med par skyes so zhes byar mi rung ngo //

analyzed: de bas na smra ba 'di yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //

original: bram ze la la /
analyzed: bram ze la la /
translated: In this regard, some ascetics or brahmins

analyzed: 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra ste /
translated: view and proclaim:

analyzed: bdag gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba ji srid du 'dug cing sdod la 'tsho ba de srid du /

analyzed: nad dang bcas pa / 'bras dang bcas pa / zug rngu dang bcas pa /
translated: I have illness,üîΩI have boils,üîΩI have pain,

analyzed: rims dang bcas pa /
translated: I have fever,

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
translated: Among these, the view of the perishable composite is an error

original: bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: with regard to self, thinking that there is a self where there is no self.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i phyogs gcig ni /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i phyogs gcig ni /
translated: One part of the view of the two extremes is an error

original: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du phyin ci log pa'o //üîΩlta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du sems phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du phyin ci log pa'o // lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du sems phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: with regard to impermanence, thinking that there is permanence.üîΩThe overesteeming of morality and ritual is an errorüîΩwith regard to purity, thinking that there is purity.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The overesteeming of false view is an error

original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: with regard to happiness, thinking that there is happiness.üîΩDesire is an error with regard to both purity and happiness, thinking that there is purity and happiness in what is impure and miserable.

original: 'dod chags ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o snyam du phyin ci log pa gnyis ka yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o snyam du phyin ci log pa gnyis ka yang yin no //
translated: Anger is an error with regard to misery, thinking that there is happiness in what is miserable.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /üîΩrnam grangs mang po ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na / rnam grangs mang po ste /
translated: What are the synonyms for the afflictions?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are many synonyms:üîΩfetters,üîΩbonds,üîΩlatent afflictions,üîΩsecondary afflictions,üîΩentanglements,

analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / 'ching ba rnams dang / bag la nyal ba rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / kun nas dkris pa rnams dang / chu bo rnams dang / sbyor ba rnams dang / nye bar len pa rnams dang /
translated: floods,üîΩbonds,üîΩappropriations,üîΩknots,üîΩobscurations,üîΩhardnesses,üîΩstains,üîΩsins,

original: mdud pa rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / tha ba rnams dang / dri ma rnams dang / sdig pa rnams dang / zug rngu rnams dang / yongs 'dzin rnams dang / rtsa ba rnams dang / nyes par spyod pa rnams dang / zag ba rnams dang /
analyzed: mdud pa rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / tha ba rnams dang / dri ma rnams dang / sdig pa rnams dang / zug rngu rnams dang / yongs 'dzin rnams dang / rtsa ba rnams dang / nyes par spyod pa rnams dang / zag ba rnams dang /
translated: thorns,üîΩclingings,üîΩroots,üîΩmisconducts,üîΩand contaminants.

original: phongs pa rnams dang / yongs su gdung ba rnams dang / 'khrug pa rnams dang / 'thab pa rnams dang / me rnams dang / rims nad rnams dang / nags sbyor rnams dang / gegs rnams dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams dang / yongs su gdung ba rnams dang / 'khrug pa rnams dang / 'thab pa rnams dang / me rnams dang / rims nad rnams dang / nags sbyor rnams dang / gegs rnams dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The synonyms of the defilements are:üîΩafflictions,üîΩbonds,üîΩlatent tendencies,

original: de la sdug bsngal kun tu sbyor bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal kun tu sbyor bar byed pas na /
translated: secondary afflictions,üîΩentanglements,

original: kun tu sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: and floods.üîΩThe afflictions are so called because they afflict the mind.

original: dge ba'i spyod pa la 'dod dgur mi byed pas na 'ching ba rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa la 'dod dgur mi byed pas na 'ching ba rnams so //
translated: The bonds are so called because they do not allow the mind to act as it wishes in virtuous activities.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yar 'phel ba thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pas na bag la nyal rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yar 'phel ba thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pas na bag la nyal rnams so //
translated: The latent tendencies are so called because they possess the seeds of all mundane increase.

original: phyin ci log rnams kyis sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //üîΩyang dang yang rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu 'byung bas na /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams kyis sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so // yang dang yang rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu 'byung bas na /
translated: The secondary afflictions are so called because they afflict the mind with errors.

original: kun tu dkris pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun tu dkris pa rnams so //
translated: The entanglements are so called because they frequently and continuously arise.üîΩThe floods are so called because they carry away the mind from the virtues.

original: gting dpag dka' ba dang / rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pas na chu bo rnams so //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba dang / rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pas na chu bo rnams so //
translated: They are called floods because they carry one off with their stream.

original: log par sgrub pa'i thabs yin bas na sbyor ba rnams so //üîΩlus kyi rgyun @85a * //üîΩnye bar len bar byed pas na /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i thabs yin bas na sbyor ba rnams so // lus kyi rgyun @85a * // nye bar len bar byed pas na /
translated: They are called yokes because they are the means of misapprehending.

original: nye bar len pa rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnams so //
translated: They are called appropriating aggregates because they appropriate the continuity of the body.üîΩThey are called clingings because they cause the appropriation of the body.

original: dgrol dka' bas na mdud pa rnams so //
analyzed: dgrol dka' bas na mdud pa rnams so //
translated: They are called knots because they are difficult to untie.

original: de kho na'i don la sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: They are called obscurations because they obscure the meaning of reality.

original: dge ba'i lo thog gi zhing du mar gyur pas na tha ba rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i lo thog gi zhing du mar gyur pas na tha ba rnams so //
translated: They are called thorns because they are the field in which the crop of virtue is sown.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas na dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas na dri ma rnams so //
translated: They are called stains because they are by nature defiled.

original: rtag tu gnod par byed pas na sdig pa rnams so //üîΩrab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang / ring du song bas na /
analyzed: rtag tu gnod par byed pas na sdig pa rnams so // rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang / ring du song bas na /
translated: They are called evils because they always cause harm.

original: zug rngu rnams so //üîΩphung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
analyzed: zug rngu rnams so // phung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
translated: They are called arrows because they are characterized by great violence and they go far.

original: yongs 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: yongs 'dzin rnams so //
translated: They are called adversities because they are the cause of the appropriation of the aggregates.

original: mi dge ba'i rten du gyur bas na rtsa ba rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rten du gyur bas na rtsa ba rnams so //
translated: They are roots because they are the basis of the unwholesome.

original: log par sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
translated: They are misdeeds because they are the nature of wrong practice.

original: sems rnam par g-yengs par byed pas na zag pa rnams so //üîΩlongs spyod kyis chog gi shes pas na phongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs par byed pas na zag pa rnams so // longs spyod kyis chog gi shes pas na phongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are defilements because they distract the mind.üîΩThey are poverty because they are dissatisfaction with wealth.

original: 'dod pas phongs par byed pas na yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs par byed pas na yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
translated: They are torments because they torment with desire.

original: rgud pa 'dren par byed pas na 'khrug pa rnams so //üîΩ'thab rtsod dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: rgud pa 'dren par byed pas na 'khrug pa rnams so // 'thab rtsod dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: They are disturbances because they lead to misfortune.üîΩThey are quarrels because they are the cause of strife, contention, accusation, and dispute.

original: 'thab pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'thab pa rnams so //
translated: They are fights because they are the cause of quarrels.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags so cog gi bud shing sreg par byed pas na me rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags so cog gi bud shing sreg par byed pas na me rnams so //
translated: They are fires because they burn the fuel of all accumulated wholesome actions.

original: nad chen por gyur pas na rims nad rnams so //
analyzed: nad chen por gyur pas na rims nad rnams so //
translated: They are fevers because they are great sicknesses.

original: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi shing sgrub par byed pas na nags sbyor rnams so //
analyzed: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi shing sgrub par byed pas na nags sbyor rnams so //
translated: They are thickets because they produce the trees of various bodies.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags par byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'thob pa'i bar chad byed pas na gegs rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags par byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'thob pa'i bar chad byed pas na gegs rnams te /
translated: The hindrances are so called because they create attachment to the objects of desire and they create obstacles to the attainment of supramundane dharmas.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: These are synonyms for all the defilements.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor nyon mongs pa de dang de dag rnam grangs de dang der gzhag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gtso bor nyon mongs pa de dang de dag rnam grangs de dang der gzhag go //
translated: The Lord has established these and other synonyms for the defilements in the scriptures, according to his own ideas.

original: kun tu sbyor ba rnams zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu ste /üîΩrjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu ste / rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The fetters are nine in number:üîΩthe fetter of passion, the fetter of repugnance, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the fetter of views, the fetter of envy, the fetter of avarice, the fetter of anger, and the fetter of hypocrisy.

original: 'ching ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba gsum ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba gsum ste /
translated: The bonds are three in number:

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so //üîΩbag la nyal zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so // bag la nyal zhes bya ba ni /
translated: passion, repugnance, and ignorance.

original: bag la nyal bdun te /
analyzed: bag la nyal bdun te /
translated: The latent proclivities are seven in number:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ba dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ba dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the latent proclivity of passion, the latent proclivity of repugnance, the latent proclivity of pride, the latent proclivity of ignorance, the latent proclivity of views, the latent proclivity of envy, and the latent proclivity of avarice.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The secondary defilements are:

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three secondary mental afflictions:

original: @85b 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so //
analyzed: @85b 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so //
translated: attachment, hostility, and ignorance.

original: kun nas dkris pa rnams zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa brgyad de /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnams zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight entanglements:

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'o //
translated: shamelessness, lack of abashment, lethargy, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, and stinginess.

original: chu bo rnams zhes bya ba ni chu bo bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo rnams zhes bya ba ni chu bo bzhi ste /
translated: There are four floods:

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: the flood of sensuality, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.

original: chu bo rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩnye bar len pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu bo rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o // nye bar len pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fetters should be understood in the same way as the floods.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four graspings:üîΩgrasping at sensuality,üîΩgrasping at views,üîΩgrasping at morality and asceticism, andüîΩgrasping at a doctrine of self.

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: mdud pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mdud pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdud pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mdud pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four knots are:üîΩthe knot of covetousness,üîΩthe knot of malice,üîΩthe knot of adherence to observances and rituals, and

original: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di ni bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di ni bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of adherence to views as supreme.

original: sgrib pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga ste /
translated: The five obstructions are:üîΩthe obstruction of desire,üîΩthe obstruction of malice,üîΩthe obstruction of sloth,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: the obstruction of excitedness and regret, andüîΩthe obstruction of doubt.

original: tha ba rnams zhes bya ba ni tha ba gsum ste /
analyzed: tha ba rnams zhes bya ba ni tha ba gsum ste /
translated: The three poisons are:üîΩgreed,üîΩhatred, and

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
translated: delusion.

original: tha ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: tha ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: As with the poisons,

original: dri ma rnams dang / sdig pa rnams dang / zug rngu rnams dang / yongs 'dzin dang / nyes par spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dri ma rnams dang / sdig pa rnams dang / zug rngu rnams dang / yongs 'dzin dang / nyes par spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the defilements, the bad actions, the wounds, the bonds, and the bad practices.

original: rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba gsum ste /
translated: The roots are three:

original: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //

original: zag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa gsum ste /

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the impurity of craving, the impurity of existence, and the impurity of ignorance.

analyzed: phongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni phongs pa gsum ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams so /
translated: The sufferings are three:üîΩthe suffering of craving, the suffering of existence, and the suffering of ignorance.

analyzed: phongs pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gdung ba rnams dang / 'khrug pa rnams dang / 'thab pa rnams dang / me rnams dang / rims nad rnams dang / nags sbyor rnams kyang de @86a * //
translated: The same applies to the torments, the burnings, the quarrels, the fires, the fevers, and the snares.

original: dang 'dra'o // gags rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang 'dra'o // gags rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The obstacles are three:

original: gags lnga ste /
analyzed: gags lnga ste /
translated: There are five obstacles:

analyzed: lus la lta ba dang / 'dod pa la lta ba dang / 'dre bar gnas pa dang / mthun pa'i gtam med pa dang / chung ngu dang ngan pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o // ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten na 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be understood as included in the application.üîΩThe future is called the desirable because it is to be desired.

original: 'das pa'i dus la brten na 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sdug pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la brten na 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sdug pa'o //
translated: The past is called the beautiful because it is to be desired.

original: da ltar gyi dus la brten dngos po dang nyams su myong bar 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar rig par bya'o //üîΩyang dag par dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la brten dngos po dang nyams su myong bar 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar rig par bya'o // yang dag par dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is to be liked and to be loved because it is desired as a present thing and as an experience.üîΩIt is to be delighted in because it is the delight of many people.

original: skye bo mang pos 'dod pa dang / skye ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang pos 'dod pa dang / skye ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is to be born because it is the delight of those who are born.

original: chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is to be concentrated because it is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims kyi yan lag yongs su bzung ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yan lag yongs su bzung ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is to be without regret, etc., because it is the meditative concentration that results from the possession of the branches of morality.

original: de la zher 'debs @89b pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang gi dug gtong ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: de la zher 'debs @89b pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang gi dug gtong ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'o //
translated: It is to be harmful to others because it is the sending of the poison of hatred.

original: rtsub pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i reg pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol la rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i reg pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol la rtsub pa'o //
translated: It is to be rough because it is the rough contact that causes suffering.

original: lhag ma rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in the opposite sense to the bright side.

original: tshig kyal ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshig kyal ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase one who is frivolous is a statement of the reason.

original: dus gsum du tshig lnga'i dbang du byas pa ste /üîΩlog par gleng ba'i dus na dus ma yin par smra bas na dus la ma bab par smra ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du tshig lnga'i dbang du byas pa ste / log par gleng ba'i dus na dus ma yin par smra bas na dus la ma bab par smra ba'o //
translated: The three times are from the perspective of the five types of speech.üîΩWhen one is speaking falsely, one speaks at an improper time. Therefore, it says, one speaks at an improper time.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par smra bas na /üîΩyang dag pa ma yin par smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par smra bas na / yang dag pa ma yin par smra ba'o //
translated: When one is speaking incorrectly, one speaks falsely. Therefore, it says, one speaks falsely.

original: don dang mi ldan par smra bas na don med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par smra bas na don med par smra ba'o //
translated: When one is speaking without meaning, one speaks without meaning. Therefore, it says, one speaks without meaning.

original: rtsub por smra bas na chos ma yin par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rtsub por smra bas na chos ma yin par smra ba'o //
translated: When one is speaking harshly, one speaks unrighteously. Therefore, it says, one speaks unrighteously.

original: zhe sdang gi skabs smra bas na ma brtags par smra ba'o //üîΩchos log par ston pa'i dus na ma bsams shing legs par ma brtags par ston pas na ma brtags pa'i tshig smra ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi skabs smra bas na ma brtags par smra ba'o // chos log par ston pa'i dus na ma bsams shing legs par ma brtags par ston pas na ma brtags pa'i tshig smra ba yin no //
translated: When one is speaking out of hatred, one speaks without having examined the situation. Therefore, it says, one speaks without having examined the situation.üîΩ When one is teaching a false doctrine, one teaches without having thought about it and without having examined it well. Therefore, it says, one speaks without having examined the situation.

original: brnyas shing nyan pa na ston pas na dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brnyas shing nyan pa na ston pas na dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: When one is teaching while being disrespected, one teaches at an improper time. Therefore, it says, at an improper time.üîΩ When one's earlier and later statements are not connected, one's speech is not connected. Therefore, it says, not connected.üîΩ

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i don 'brel pa med pas na ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i don 'brel pa med pas na ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: Not connected means that one's earlier and later statements are not connected.

original: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ston pas na ldan par ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ston pas na ldan par ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not endowed with reason, because it teaches arguments that are not endowed with reason.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i dpe nye bar sgrub pas na dpe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i dpe nye bar sgrub pas na dpe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not endowed with an example, because it establishes an example that is not related.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su ston pas na chos dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su ston pas na chos dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not endowed with the Dharma, because it teaches the afflictions.

original: bzhad gad dang / glu la sogs pas rtse ba'i dus dang / zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang / bzhad pa dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa la lta ba'i dus na don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bzhad gad dang / glu la sogs pas rtse ba'i dus dang / zlos gar mkhan dang / gar mkhan dang / bzhad pa dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa la lta ba'i dus na don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not endowed with meaning, because it is a distraction at the time of laughter, singing, and so on, and at the time of seeing dancing, acting, comedy, and so on.

original: don mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: don mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, the meaning is this:

original: dus gsum ji skad bstan pa dag tu smra ba de ni tshig kyal par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: dus gsum ji skad bstan pa dag tu smra ba de ni tshig kyal par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The teaching of the three times is taught to be idle chatter.

original: brnab sems can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brnab sems can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who is covetous‚Äù means that

original: gzhan gyi nor la 'dod chags kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor la 'dod chags kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: one is under the power of desire for the wealth of others.

original: bdag gir bya bar nges par byed pa dang du len pas na kun tu chags pa drag po can no //
analyzed: bdag gir bya bar nges par byed pa dang du len pas na kun tu chags pa drag po can no //
translated: One is a person of intense attachment, because one is committed to making it one‚Äôs own.

original: nor zhes bya ba ni zong du bya ba'i nor gyi rigs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nor zhes bya ba ni zong du bya ba'i nor gyi rigs gang yin pa'o //
translated: Wealth refers to the type of wealth that is marketable.

original: yo byad ces bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad ces bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Goods refers to what is used up.

original: rdzas zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka bsdus pa'o //
translated: Substantiality refers to the combination of both.

original: gzhan dag gi gang yin pa de bdag gir gyur cig ces bya ba ni brnab sems kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi gang yin pa de bdag gir gyur cig ces bya ba ni brnab sems kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmay what belongs to others become mine‚Äù indicates the mode of activity of covetousness.

original: mdor bsdu na brnab sems kyi ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: mdor bsdu na brnab sems kyi ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o//
translated: In brief, covetousness should be understood as having the nature of desire, the object of desire, and the mode of desire.

original: @90a * // gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //üîΩsems can pha rol po rnams la gnod sems kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: @90a * // gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go // sems can pha rol po rnams la gnod sems kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe is filled with a mind of malice‚Äù is the statement of the thesis.üîΩMalice is a hostile mental activity that is directed toward sentient beings who are other than oneself.

original: gnod par bya ba nges par skyed ba dang du len pas na yid kyi kun tu rtog pa rab tu sdang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba nges par skyed ba dang du len pas na yid kyi kun tu rtog pa rab tu sdang ba'o //
translated: It is a hostile mental activity that is directed toward sentient beings who are other than oneself.

original: bsad na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsad na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhow good it would be if he were dead‚Äù indicates the mode of activity of malice.

original: lus bsad de ma rung bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: lus bsad de ma rung bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: He wishes that the body be killed and destroyed.

original: bcings na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni lus la nyam nga bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'o //üîΩpham par gyur na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi longs spyod rgud par byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bcings na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni lus la nyam nga bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'o // pham par gyur na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi longs spyod rgud par byed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: He wishes that the body be bound and suffer misfortune.üîΩHe wishes that the wealth of others be destroyed.

original: tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi longs spyod rang rgud par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur na ci ma rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi longs spyod rang rgud par 'dod pa ste /
translated: He wishes that his own wealth be destroyed.

original: don mdor bsdu na ni /
analyzed: don mdor bsdu na ni /
translated: In brief, the meaning is as follows:

original: snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand it as before.

original: log par lta ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: log par lta ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: He has a false view means the words of the teaching.

original: 'di ltar lta zhes bya ba de ni bdag nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don la bzod cing 'dod pa yin par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar lta zhes bya ba de ni bdag nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don la bzod cing 'dod pa yin par yongs su ston to //
translated: He views in this way means he is fully aware of and accepts the meaning that he wishes to express.

original: 'di skad du smra ba zhes bya ba de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don pha rol rnams 'dzin du 'jug par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: 'di skad du smra ba zhes bya ba de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don pha rol rnams 'dzin du 'jug par yongs su ston to //
translated: He speaks in this way means he fully understands the meaning that he wishes to express.

original: bsam pa rnam pa gsum po /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam pa gsum po /
translated: The three kinds of thought areüîΩthe thought of wealth, the thought of purity, and the thought of worshiping the gods.

original: longs spyod kyi bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / lha la mchod pa'i bsam pa'i sbyin pa la skur ba btab pa'i phyir sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi bsam pa dang / dag pa'i bsam pa dang / lha la mchod pa'i bsam pa'i sbyin pa la skur ba btab pa'i phyir sbyin pa med do //
translated: They say that there is no giving because they deny the giving that is motivated by these three kinds of thought.

original: mchod sbyin med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do zhes zer te /
translated: They say that there is no sacrifice

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni gsang sngags dang / me dang / lha la mchod pa'i bsam pa can gyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni gsang sngags dang / me dang / lha la mchod pa'i bsam pa can gyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: because they deny the sacrifice that is motivated by the thought of worshiping the gods, mantras, and fire.üîΩThey say that there is no good conduct

original: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i dge ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /üîΩlegs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i dge ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la skur ba btab pa'i phyir / legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: because they deny the virtues that arise from morality and from meditation, together with their opposites and their antidotes, and the virtues that arise from giving and its opposite.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that there is no bad conductüîΩbecause they deny the three kinds of bad conduct.üîΩThey say that there is no result of good or bad conduct

original: dge ba rnam pa gsum po mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa de dag gi 'bras bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba rnam pa gsum po mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa de dag gi 'bras bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /
translated: because they deny the results of the three kinds of good conduct and their opposites.

original: legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the results of good actions do not exist.

original: 'jug pa'i gnas kyi rkyen la skur ba btab pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i gnas kyi rkyen la skur ba btab pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: They say that this world does not exist, because they deny the condition of the basis of engagement.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the other world does not exist.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i rkyen la skur ba btab pa dang / de'i sa bon gyi rkyen la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /üîΩ@90b pa med do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i rkyen la skur ba btab pa dang / de'i sa bon gyi rkyen la skur ba btab pa'i phyir / @90b pa med do //
translated: Because they deny the condition of the result of that and the condition of the seed of that,

original: ma med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma med do zhes zer ro //
translated: they say that father and mother do not exist.

original: 'jug pa'i skyes bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir sems can skye ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i skyes bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir sems can skye ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they deny the engaged person, they say that sentient beings are not born.

original: 'jug pa'i gnyen po ldog pa la skur ba btab pa'i phyir 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes rgyas par zer ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i gnyen po ldog pa la skur ba btab pa'i phyir 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes rgyas par zer ro //
translated: Because they deny the engaged antidote, they say that there are no arhats in the world.

original: de la so so rang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa zhi ngar gyur pa'i phyir yang dag par song ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la so so rang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa zhi ngar gyur pa'i phyir yang dag par song ba rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who have gone rightly‚Äù because their individual defilements have been pacified.

original: sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa rnam par spangs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa rnam par spangs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: They are ‚Äúwell-established‚Äù because they have eliminated the wrong practice of beings.

original: tshe 'di zhes bya ba rgyu'i dus su'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di zhes bya ba rgyu'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this life‚Äù means at the time of the cause.

original: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i dus su'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the next life‚Äù means at the time of the effect.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi skyes bu'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi skyes bu'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy themselves‚Äù means by their own personal efforts.

original: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni drug pas so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni drug pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the superknowledges‚Äù means by the sixth.

original: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving realized‚Äù means by the path of insight.

original: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving accomplished‚Äù means by the path of cultivation.

original: rab tu rtogs par byed ces bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa bdag nyid kyis kyang shes shing gzhan dag la yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs par byed ces bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa bdag nyid kyis kyang shes shing gzhan dag la yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey make it fully evident‚Äù means that they understand it themselves and make it understood by others.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMy births are destroyed‚Äù and so on is to be analyzed as before.

original: de la mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the summary:

original: rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa dang / byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa dang / byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa bstan te /
translated: Denial of cause, denial of effect, denial of action, and denial of existent entities.

original: de la byed pa ni sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i byed pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la byed pa ni sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i byed pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi byed pa'o //
translated: Action is the action of planting seeds, the action of grasping, the action of coming and going, and the action of the karma that will be born.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni rnam grangs gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa dang / rkyen dang bcas par 'jug pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / de'i gnyen por gyur pa ldog pa la skur ba 'debs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni rnam grangs gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa dang / rkyen dang bcas par 'jug pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / de'i gnyen por gyur pa ldog pa la skur ba 'debs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The summary meaning is this: Another enumeration is the denial of the engagement of a person who engages with cause and effect and with conditions, and the denial of the cessation that is the antidote to that.

original: de la 'jug pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni /
translated: Among them, the denial of engagement is

original: rgyu la skur ba 'debs par blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: rgyu la skur ba 'debs par blta bar bya'i /
translated: to be seen as the denial of cause,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the denial of intrinsic identity.

original: ldog pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni yon tan la skur ba 'debs par blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: ldog pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni yon tan la skur ba 'debs par blta bar bya'i /
translated: The denial of the opposite is the denial of the good qualities, not the denial of the person.

original: gang zag la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The denial of the good qualities is the denial of the good qualities of the person.

original: de la dkar po'i phyogs ni thams cad kyang 'di las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dkar po'i phyogs ni thams cad kyang 'di las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The side of virtue should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: gang la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod pa de yang bshad par bya ste /üîΩ'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la brten @91a * //
analyzed: gang la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod pa de yang bshad par bya ste / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la brten @91a * //
translated: The special characteristics of the person should also be explained.

original: nas tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: nas tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúpure conduct‚Äù is based on the avoidance of sexual misconduct.

original: de yang yongs su dag pa gsum gyis dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang yongs su dag pa gsum gyis dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as pure by reason of three purities:

original: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni dag par byed pa ste /

original: de ni gzhan yid ches pa dag pa'o //

analyzed: de la mu dang po ni /

analyzed: byas la rtsod pa'i tshe rgyal ba'o //

analyzed: de la bud med kyi lus la reg pa nyams su mi len pa'i phyir dring ba med pa'o //

analyzed: yid brtan par gyur pas na yid ches pa'o //

analyzed: de la rtsod pa na tshad mar gzhag pa yin pas gzhag par bya'o //

original: mdor bsdu na nye bar gzung ba rnam pa gsum du yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na nye bar gzung ba rnam pa gsum du yongs su bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: bsam pa nye bar gzung ba dang / bsko ba nye bar gzung ba dang / bya ba nye bar gzung ba'o //
translated: in terms of his attitude, in terms of his appointment, and in terms of his actions.

original: de la chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i srog gcod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i srog gcod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the taking of life according to the principle of the characteristics of the teaching?

original: gsad pa'i bsam pa can /
analyzed: gsad pa'i bsam pa can /
translated: It is the intention to kill.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /
translated: It is the state of mind of one who is afflicted.

original: srog chags pha rol po de nyid la gsad pa'i sbyor ba byas shing gsad pa mthar thug par byas pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags pha rol po de nyid la gsad pa'i sbyor ba byas shing gsad pa mthar thug par byas pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the action of the body which is the performance and the completion of the act of killing another living being.

original: ma byin par len pa gang zhen /üîΩrku 'phrog byas pa'i bsam pa can /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa gang zhen / rku 'phrog byas pa'i bsam pa can / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /

translated: It is the action of the body which is the performance and the completion of the act of stealing another's possession with a thieving thought and a defiled thought.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is sexual misconduct?

original: bsten pa'i bsam pa can nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dag tu de nyid la 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i sbyor ba byas pa dang /

translated: It is the action of the body which is the performance and the completion of the act of sexual misconduct with a thought of intimacy and a defiled thought, in that which should not be practiced, in that which is not the proper limb, in that which is not the proper place, and in that which is not the proper time.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i mthar thug par byas pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i mthar thug par byas pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is an action of the body which is the culmination of sexual misconduct.

original: bsdun du smra ba gang zhe na /üîΩ'du shes bsgyur te smra bar 'dod pa /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /
analyzed: bsdun du smra ba gang zhe na / 'du shes bsgyur te smra bar 'dod pa / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas /
translated: What is slander?

original: sems can gzhan dag la de nyid la sgyu'i dbang po'i sbyor ba byas pa dang / de nyid la sgyu'i dbang po mthar thug par byas pa'i ngag gi las gang yin pa'o //

original: phra ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: phra ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is harsh speech?

original: dbye ba'i bsam pa can nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas sems can pha rol de nyid la dbye ba'i sbyor ba byas pa dang / dbye ba'i mthar thug par byas pa'i ngag gi las gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: log par lta ba'o //

analyzed: las kyi gnas skabs gang zhe na /

analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /

analyzed: 'bring gis ni yi dags rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro//

analyzed: dge ba'i las chung dus ni mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'bring gis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: chen pos ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen pos ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The strong form leads to rebirth among the gods of the form and formless realms.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi gnas skabs chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi gnas skabs chung ngu gang zhe na /

analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gzhi chung ngu gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: gnas skabs 'bring ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gzhi 'bring gang yin pa'o // gnas skabs chen po ni /

analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gzhi chen po gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: dge ba ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i gzhi ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
