translated: There is action that is intended and there is action that is not intended.üîΩThere is action that is weighty and there is action that is not weighty.üîΩThere is action that is near and there is action that is far.üîΩThere is action that is certain to be experienced and there is action that is uncertain to be experienced.üîΩThere is action that is experienced in this life and there is action that is not experienced in this life.üîΩThere is action that is experienced in the next life and there is action that is not experienced in the next life.üîΩThere is action that is experienced in other lives and there is action that is not experienced in other lives.

original: de bzhin du rnam par smin par nges pa dang / rnam par smin par ma nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par smin par nges pa dang / rnam par smin par ma nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
translated: There is action that is wholesome and there is action that is unwholesome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / sdom pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pas bsdus pa yang ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / sdom pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pas bsdus pa yang ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba dang /
translated: It is neutral, included in vows, included in negative commitments, not included in vows and not included in negative commitments, arisen from giving,

original: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba dang / bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba dang / bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: arisen from ethics, arisen from meditation, merit, demerit, stable, to be experienced as pleasure, to be experienced as pain, to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain,

original: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: to be experienced in this life, to be experienced after rebirth, to be experienced in a third life, past, future and present, possessing desire realm objects,

original: gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: It is related to form, it is related to the formless, it is related to training, it is related to no longer training, it is related to neither training nor no longer training, it is to be abandoned by seeing, it is to be abandoned by cultivation,

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa dang / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin pa gnag cing dkar ba dang / las gnag @96b pa yang ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med de /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa dang / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin pa gnag cing dkar ba dang / las gnag @96b pa yang ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med de /
translated: it is not to be abandoned, it is black with black ripening, it is white with white ripening, it is black and white with black and white ripening, it is neither black nor white with neither black nor white ripening and it is exhausted by that action.

original: de las zad par 'gyur ba dang / yon po'i las dang / nyes pa'i las dang / snyigs ma'i las dang / gtsang ba'i las dang / thub pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: de las zad par 'gyur ba dang / yon po'i las dang / nyes pa'i las dang / snyigs ma'i las dang / gtsang ba'i las dang / thub pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: It is crooked action, it is faulty action, it is defiled action, it is pure action, it is the action of the Sage.

original: byas pa'i las gang zhe na /üîΩbsams pa 'am /
analyzed: byas pa'i las gang zhe na /üîΩbsams pa 'am /
translated: What is action that is done?üîΩIt is action that is done intentionally.

original: bsams nas kyang lus dang ngag gis kun nas bslangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsams nas kyang lus dang ngag gis kun nas bslangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and having reflected, to instigate it by body and speech.

original: ma byas pa'i las ni ma bsams pa'am /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i las ni ma bsams pa'am /
translated: Unaccumulated action is that which is not reflected upon,

original: ma bsams nas kyang lus dang ngag gis kun nas ma bslangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsams nas kyang lus dang ngag gis kun nas ma bslangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or having reflected, is not instigated by body and speech.

original: bsags pa'i las ni las rnam pa bcu ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsags pa'i las ni las rnam pa bcu ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Accumulated action is any action except for ten types of action.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩrmi lam du byas pa dang / ma shes par byas pa dang / bsams bzhin ma yin par byas pa dang / drag po ma yin la rgyun chags ma yin par byas pa dang / nor bas byas pa dang / brjed pas byas pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rmi lam du byas pa dang / ma shes par byas pa dang / bsams bzhin ma yin par byas pa dang / drag po ma yin la rgyun chags ma yin par byas pa dang / nor bas byas pa dang / brjed pas byas pa dang /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mi 'dod bzhin du byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'gyod pas bsal ba dang / gnyen pos bsal ba ste /üîΩlas rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'gyod pas bsal ba dang / gnyen pos bsal ba ste / las rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action done in a dream, action done unknowingly, action done without intention, action done without intensity, action done without continuity, action done by mistake, action done absentmindedly, action done unwillingly, action that is naturally indeterminate, and action that is counteracted by regret.üîΩExcept for these ten types of action, any other action is accumulated.

original: ma bsags pa'i las ni rnam pa bcu po ji skad bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma bsags pa'i las ni rnam pa bcu po ji skad bstan pa nyid do //
translated: Unaccumulated action is the very ten types just mentioned.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i las ni /üîΩbsams bzhin du byas pa'am /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i las ni / bsams bzhin du byas pa'am /
translated: Action born of reflection isüîΩthat which is done intentionally

original: bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or accumulated.

original: ma bsags pa las byung ba'i las ni /
analyzed: ma bsags pa las byung ba'i las ni /
translated: Action born of non-accumulation is

original: bsams bzhin ma yin par byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin ma yin par byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is done unintentionally.

original: myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa'i las ni /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa'i las ni /
translated: Action whose results are to be experienced is

original: bsams bzhin du byas pa dang / bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du byas pa dang / bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is done intentionally and accumulated.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa'i las ni /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa'i las ni /
translated: Action whose results are not to be experienced is

original: bsams bzhin du byas la ma bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du byas la ma bsags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is done intentionally but not accumulated.üîΩAction whose results have already matured is

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa'i las ni 'bras bu byin zin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa'i las ni 'bras bu byin zin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that whose results have already been given.

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'i las ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'i las ni /
translated: Action whose results have not matured is

original: 'bras bu ma byin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma byin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that whose results have not been given.

original: dge ba'i las ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i las ni /
translated: Virtuous action is

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is based on non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: mi dge ba'i las ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las ni /
translated: Non-virtuous action isüîΩthat which is based on attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩlung du ma bstan pa'i las ni /üîΩma @97a * //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa'o // lung du ma bstan pa'i las ni / ma @97a * //
translated: It is that which is based on non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gzhir gyur pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gzhir gyur pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Indeterminate action is that which is not based on non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion,

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gzhir gyur pa yang ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩsdom pas bsdus pa'i las ni /
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gzhir gyur pa yang ma yin pa gang yin pa'o // sdom pas bsdus pa'i las ni /
translated: but also is not based on attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'am /
translated: Action included in the moral code is that which is included in the moral code of individual liberation,

original: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / spong ba'i sdom pas bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / spong ba'i sdom pas bsdus pa'am /
translated: that which is included in the moral code of the meditative absorptions and meditative attainments,

original: zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩsdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'i las ni /üîΩsdom pa ma yin pa'i ris bcu gnyis po rnams kyi gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o // sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'i las ni / sdom pa ma yin pa'i ris bcu gnyis po rnams kyi gang yin pa ste /
translated: and that which is included in the moral code of the uncontaminated.üîΩAction included in immorality is that which is included in the twelve types of immorality.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ris bcu gnyis ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ris bcu gnyis ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve types of immorality are as follows:

original: lug gsod pa rnams dang / bya gag 'tshong ba rnams dang / nya pa rnams dang / bya pa rnams dang / rgyas 'chor ba rnams dang / chom rkun pa rnams dang / gshed ma rnams dang / btson srung rnams dang / log po pa rnams dang /
analyzed: lug gsod pa rnams dang / bya gag 'tshong ba rnams dang / nya pa rnams dang / bya pa rnams dang / rgyas 'chor ba rnams dang / chom rkun pa rnams dang / gshed ma rnams dang / btson srung rnams dang / log po pa rnams dang /
translated: those who are thieves,üîΩthose who are executioners,üîΩthose who are jailers,üîΩthose who are butchers,üîΩthose who are elephant catchers,üîΩthose who are snake charmers,

original: gnod byed rnams dang / glang po che 'dzin pa rnams dang / sprul tshogs can rnams so //
analyzed: gnod byed rnams dang / glang po che 'dzin pa rnams dang / sprul tshogs can rnams so //
translated: and so on.

original: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pas bsdus pa'i las ni /
analyzed: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pas bsdus pa'i las ni /
translated: Karma that is neither restraint nor non-restraint is as follows:

original: sdom pa rnam pa gsum yang ma gtogs /
analyzed: sdom pa rnam pa gsum yang ma gtogs /
translated: Except for the three types of restraint,

original: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ris kyi las kyang ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ris kyi las kyang ma gtogs pa /
translated: and except for the class of non-restraint,

original: de las gzhan pa'i ris kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ris kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: any other class of virtuous, non-virtuous, or neutral karma.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba ni /
translated: Karma arising from generosity

original: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gnas las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gnas las rig par bya ste /
translated: should be understood from the basis, the motivation, the nature itself, and the location.

original: de la gzhi ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i gzhi'o//
analyzed: de la gzhi ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i gzhi'o//
translated: The basis is the basis of nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: kun nas slong ba ni /üîΩsbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtang ba'i phyir /
translated: The instigation isüîΩthe intention that instigates the karma of body and speech in order to give up the thing that is to be given.

original: lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is associated with nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la kun nas bslangs pa'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la kun nas bslangs pa'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: The essence is the karma of body and speech that is instigated by the intention to give up the thing that is to be given.

original: de la gnas ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po dang / len pa po ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po dang / len pa po ni gnas yin no //
translated: The basis is the thing that is to be given and the recipient.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the giving,

original: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las @97b byung ba la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las @97b byung ba la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: so too should one understand the morality and the meditation.

original: de la tshul khrims las byung ba'i gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims las byung ba'i gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba ni 'dra'o //
translated: The basis and the motivation are the same as for the morality.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sdom pas bsdus pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sdom pas bsdus pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las so //
translated: The essence is the physical and verbal karma included in the vow.

original: gnas ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gnas ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The object is the thing taught as sentient or non-sentient.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba'i gzhi ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba'i gzhi ni /
translated: The basis of the meditation is

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzhi ste /
translated: the basis of samadhi.

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
translated: It is non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: kun nas slong ba ni de dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni de dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa'i sems pa'o //
translated: The motivation is the intention to accomplish the samadhi endowed with those.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The essence is the samadhi.

original: gnas ni phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The object is the realm of sentient beings in the ten directions who are neither happy nor suffering.

original: sbyin bdag gi rtags rnams dang / tshul khrims can gyi rtags rnams dang / sgom pa'i rtags rnams ni snga ma bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi rtags rnams dang / tshul khrims can gyi rtags rnams dang / sgom pa'i rtags rnams ni snga ma bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: The signs of the giver, the signs of the moral person, and the signs of the meditator should all be understood as before.

original: bsod nams kyi las ni bde 'gror rnam par smin pa dang / 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las ni bde 'gror rnam par smin pa dang / 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Meritorious action is that which is good and has a happy rebirth as its maturation, and that which has experience in the five destinies as its maturation.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i las ni ngan song du rnam par smin pa dang / 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i las ni ngan song du rnam par smin pa dang / 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nonmeritorious action is that which is bad and has an unhappy rebirth as its maturation, and that which has experience in the five destinies as its maturation.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rnam par smin pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rnam par smin pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Immovable action is that which is good and has a formless realm rebirth as its maturation, and that which has experience in the form and formless realms as its maturation.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsam gtan gsum myong bar 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsam gtan gsum myong bar 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action that produces pleasant experience is that which has the third concentration as its maturation, and that which is immovable.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur pa'i las ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur pa'i las ni /
translated: Action that produces painful experience is that which is nonmeritorious.üîΩAction that produces neither pleasant nor painful experience is that which is meritorious and has a form realm rebirth as its maturation, and that which has experience in the desire realm as its maturation.

original: thams cad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the action that ripens as the consciousness of the store-consciousness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The fourth meditation and the higher stages are unshakable.

original: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action to be experienced in this life is that the effects of which are experienced in this very life.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bar du ma chod par skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bar du ma chod par skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action to be experienced after rebirth is that the effects of which are experienced in the next birth without interruption.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni de phan chad du skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni de phan chad du skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action to be experienced in some other life is that the effects of which are experienced in a later birth.

original: 'das pa'i las ni bag chags gyi gnas skabs @98a * //üîΩ'bras bu byin zin pa'am /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las ni bag chags gyi gnas skabs @98a * // 'bras bu byin zin pa'am /
translated: Past action is that which has already passed.

original: 'bras bu ma byin pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i las ni ma skyes shing /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma byin pa gang yin pa'o // ma 'ongs pa'i las ni ma skyes shing /
translated: It is that which has already given its effect or that which has not yet given its effect.

original: mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Future action is that which has not yet arisen or that which has not yet occurred.

original: da ltar gyi las ni mngon par 'dus byas shing mngon par bsags la zhig par ma gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi las ni mngon par 'dus byas shing mngon par bsags la zhig par ma gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Present action is that which has been done and accumulated but has not yet disappeared.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i las ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i las ni /
translated: Karma associated with desire realmüîΩ

original: 'dod pa'i khams su rnam par smin cing 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su rnam par smin cing 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action associated with the realm of desire is action whose retribution is in the realm of desire and which is included in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i las ni gzugs kyi khams su rnam par smin cing gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i las ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i las ni gzugs kyi khams su rnam par smin cing gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o // gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i las ni /
translated: Action associated with the realm of fine-materiality is action whose retribution is in the realm of fine-materiality and which is included in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam par smin cing gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩslob pa'i las ni so so'i skye bo dang / so so'i skye bo ma yin pa slob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam par smin cing gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa'o // slob pa'i las ni so so'i skye bo dang / so so'i skye bo ma yin pa slob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action associated with the realm of immateriality is action whose retribution is in the realm of immateriality and which is included in the realm of immateriality.üîΩAction of the seeker is the wholesome action which exists in the stream of the seeker, i.e., of the ordinary man and of the noble one.

original: mi slob pa'i las ni mi slob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i las ni mi slob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action of the adept is the wholesome action which exists in the stream of the adept, i.e., of the noble one who is no longer a learner.

original: slob pa'i yang ma yin mi slob pa'i yang ma yin pa'i las ni gnyi ga las ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i yang ma yin mi slob pa'i yang ma yin pa'i las ni gnyi ga las ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Karma that is neither of an ordinary being nor of a learner nor of a non-learner is that which exists in a mind-stream other than those two,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las ni ngan song myong bar 'gyur pa'i mi dge pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las ni ngan song myong bar 'gyur pa'i mi dge pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the lower realms is nonvirtuous karma.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las ni bde 'gro myong bar 'gyur pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las ni bde 'gro myong bar 'gyur pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa'o//
translated: Karma to be experienced in the upper realms is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral karma.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zag pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zag pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma not to be experienced is uncontaminated karma, whether mundane or transcendent.

original: gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma that is black and has black karmic maturation is nonvirtuous.

original: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las ni mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las ni mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma that is white and has white karmic maturation is unmoving karma.

original: gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin pa gnag cing dkar ba'i las ni mi dge ba'i gnyen po bsod nams gang yin pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar bsod nams ma yin pa ma spangs la /
analyzed: gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin pa gnag cing dkar ba'i las ni mi dge ba'i gnyen po bsod nams gang yin pa ste / 'di ltar bsod nams ma yin pa ma spangs la /
translated: Black and white karma with black and white karmic maturation is meritorious karma that is the antidote to nonvirtue.

original: bsod nams kyi las su rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //üîΩlas gnag pa'i yang @98b ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las su rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o // las gnag pa'i yang @98b ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Thus, it is posited as meritorious karma, but nonmeritorious karma is not abandoned.

original: rnam par smin pa yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang med de /
translated: Karma that is neither black nor white and has no karmic maturation

original: las zad par 'gyur ba ni las gsum char yang spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las zad par 'gyur ba ni las gsum char yang spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: is the karma that exhausts karma because it is the antidote that abandons the three karmas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zag pa med pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zag pa med pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is supramundane uncontaminated karma.

original: yon po'i las ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yon po'i las ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Deceptive karma is any virtue or nonvirtue of tƒ´rthikas outside this system.

original: nyes pa'i las ni yon po'i las gang yin pa de nyid nyes pa'i las kyang de yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa'i las ni yon po'i las gang yin pa de nyid nyes pa'i las kyang de yin no //
translated: Bad karma is any deceptive karma.

original: gzhan yang nyes pa'i las ni chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la phyin ci log tu lta ba rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa log par nges pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyes pa'i las ni chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la phyin ci log tu lta ba rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa log par nges pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, faulty karma is any virtuous or nonvirtuous karma of those who are ordinary beings in this teaching, who have a distorted view of the teaching, who are attached to their own view as supreme, who are settled in error, and who are not definite in the teaching.

original: snyigs ma'i las ni yon po'i las dang / nyes pa'i las gang yin pa de nyid snyigs ma'i las kyang de yin no //üîΩgzhan yang snyigs ma'i las ni /
analyzed: snyigs ma'i las ni yon po'i las dang / nyes pa'i las gang yin pa de nyid snyigs ma'i las kyang de yin no // gzhan yang snyigs ma'i las ni /
translated: Corrupted karma is any crooked karma or faulty karma.

original: chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la nges par ma gyur pa the tshom gyi blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la nges par ma gyur pa the tshom gyi blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, corrupted karma is any virtuous or nonvirtuous karma of those who are ordinary beings in this teaching, who are not definite in the teaching, and who possess the mind of doubt.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang /
translated: Another enumeration is:

original: phyi rol gyi mu stegs can rnams kyi gsum po ni de la log par bsgrub pa'i phyir yon po'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mu stegs can rnams kyi gsum po ni de la log par bsgrub pa'i phyir yon po'o //
translated: The three of the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas are crooked because they are wrongly accomplished.

original: de la brten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a fault because it is an obstacle to the attainment of the qualities that are based on it.

original: de bzhin du brten pa la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir snyigs ma'i las su rig par bya'o //üîΩde la gtsang ba'i las ni /üîΩchos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la yang dag par nges par gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du brten pa la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir snyigs ma'i las su rig par bya'o // de la gtsang ba'i las ni / chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo bstan pa la yang dag par nges par gyur pa /
translated: In the same way, it should be understood as a defiled action because it is an obstacle to the support.

original: the tshom med pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, pure action is the wholesome action of those who belong to this religion, who are ordinary persons, who are definitely inclined toward the teaching,üîΩand who possess the intelligence that is free from doubt.

original: thub pa'i las ni chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo ma yin pa 'phags pa rnams kyi slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i dge ba'i chos gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i las ni chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo ma yin pa 'phags pa rnams kyi slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i dge ba'i chos gang yin pa'o //
translated: Noble action is the wholesome dharmas of those who belong to this religion, who are not ordinary persons, and who are ƒÅryas, whether they are still in training or beyond training.

original: las rnams kyi nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: las rnams kyi nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage of actions?

original: mdor bsdu na nyes dmigs rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na nyes dmigs rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, the disadvantage should be understood as sevenfold:

original: srog gcod pa pos srog gcod pa'i gzhi'i phyir bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par bya bar sems pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa pos srog gcod pa'i gzhi'i phyir bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par bya bar sems pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang /
translated: The killer thinks of harming himself, harming others, harming both, and producing the sin of this life, the sin of the next life,

original: tshe 'di pa dang tshe @99a * //
analyzed: tshe 'di pa dang tshe @99a * //
translated: and the sin of both this life and the next.

original: phyi ma pa'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma pa'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences the suffering and mental anguish born from that.

original: ji ltar bdag la gnod par sems she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la gnod par sems she na /
translated: How does he think of harming himself?

original: srog chags la gnod par byed pa na /üîΩgzhi de las bdag nyid gsad pa'am /üîΩbcing ba'am / nyams pa'am /
analyzed: srog chags la gnod par byed pa na / gzhi de las bdag nyid gsad pa'am / bcing ba'am / nyams pa'am /
translated: When he harms living beings,üîΩhe thinks of killing himself,üîΩbinding himself, degrading himself,

original: smad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smad par 'gyur la /
translated: or reproaching himself.

original: pha rol la gnod par ni mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol la gnod par ni mi nus pa'o //
translated: He is not able to harm others.

original: ji ltar pha rol la gnod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol la gnod par byed ce na /
translated: How does he harm others?

original: de ltar byas pas pha rol la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas pha rol la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: By doing that, he harms others.

original: gzhi de las bdag la gsad pa nas smad pa'i bar du mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi de las bdag la gsad pa nas smad pa'i bar du mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The basis is the object of killing, etc.üîΩThe intention is the desire to kill, etc.

original: gnyi ga la gnod pa ni de ltar byas pas gzhan la yang gnod par 'gyur la /üîΩgzhi de las pha rol gyis gsad pa nas /
analyzed: gnyi ga la gnod pa ni de ltar byas pas gzhan la yang gnod par 'gyur la / gzhi de las pha rol gyis gsad pa nas /
translated: The action is the actual killing, etc.

original: smad pa'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The completion is the killing, etc.,üîΩhaving done it oneself, or having caused it to be done.

original: ji ltar na tshe 'di pa'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshe 'di pa'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
translated: How does one generate the misdeed of this life?

original: ji ltar bdag la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
translated: As when one thinks of harming oneself.

original: ji ltar na tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
translated: How does one generate the misdeed of the next life?

original: ji ltar gzhan la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
translated: As when one thinks of harming another.

original: ji ltar na tshe 'di pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshe 'di pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed ce na /
translated: How does one generate the misdeed of this life and the next?

original: ji ltar gnyi ga la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyi ga la gnod par sems pa bzhin no //
translated: As when one thinks of harming both.

original: ji ltar na de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one experience the suffering and mental pain born from that?

original: srog chags la gnod pa byas pa na /
analyzed: srog chags la gnod pa byas pa na /
translated: As when one harms living beings.

original: gal te nyes dmigs rnam pa drug ma byung la /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs rnam pa drug ma byung la /
translated: If the six kinds of misfortune do not occur,

original: srog gcod pa yang de'i 'dod pa ltar ma grub par gyur na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa yang de'i 'dod pa ltar ma grub par gyur na /
translated: and if the killing is not accomplished as he wishes,

original: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gzhi las /
translated: then on the basis of the frustration of his desire,

original: de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he experiences the mental events of suffering and sorrow born from that.

original: gzhan yang nyes dmigs bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyes dmigs bcur 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, there are ten kinds of misfortune.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi skabs nas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi skabs nas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail as they are described in the sutra in the section on immorality.

original: gzhan yang dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi dang / lnga pa ste 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang gi skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes dmigs gsungs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi dang / lnga pa ste 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang gi skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes dmigs gsungs pa de dag kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has taught the misfortune that arises from the four unwholesome courses of action and the fifth, which is drinking alcohol and other intoxicants, in the context of the precepts for the lay practitioner.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩdga' byed kyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dga' byed kyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rgyas par @99b rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par @99b rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail as they are described in the Sutra on Nanda.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the defilement of birth?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of four types:

original: rab tu dbye ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / ma nges pa dang / 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / ma nges pa dang / 'jug pa'o //
translated: differentiation, suffering, uncertainty, and engagement.

original: de la skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: Differentiation of birth.

original: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as being differentiated by realm, by destiny, by place, by family, and by body in the world.

original: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: Differentiation by realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.üîΩDifferentiation by destiny.

original: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lnga po dag tu skye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lnga po dag tu skye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Birth is in the five destinies.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan bzhi po dag tu skya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan bzhi po dag tu skya ba ste /
translated: The classification of other abodes is that one is born in the desire realm in thirty-six abodes, in the form realm in eighteen abodes, and in the formless realm in four abodes.

original: de dag tu bsdoms na skye ba lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag tu bsdoms na skye ba lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in total, one is born in fifty-eight abodes.

original: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of lineage is that

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni mi rnams kyi nang du rigs ngan par skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni mi rnams kyi nang du rigs ngan par skye ba ste /
translated: one is born in the desire realm in the lowest caste.

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig gdol pa'i rigs sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig gdol pa'i rigs sam /
translated: Thus, one is born in the caste of untouchables,

original: g-yung po'i rigs sam /
analyzed: g-yung po'i rigs sam /
translated: the caste of bamboo workers,

original: shing rta mkhan gyi rigs sam /
analyzed: shing rta mkhan gyi rigs sam /
translated: the caste of cart makers,üîΩthe caste of flower workers,

original: smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs sam /
analyzed: smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs sam /
translated: or a bamboo worker,üîΩ

original: gzhan yang gang ma rabs rnams dang / dma' ba rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'tsho ba ngan pa rnams dang / chung ba rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / longs spyod chung ba rnams dang / de lta bu dag gi rigs su skye ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang ma rabs rnams dang / dma' ba rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'tsho ba ngan pa rnams dang / chung ba rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / longs spyod chung ba rnams dang / de lta bu dag gi rigs su skye ba lta bu yin te /
translated: degraded, poor, with little food and drink, and with few resources.

original: de dag ni skal ba med pa'i mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skal ba med pa'i mi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called ‚Äúpeople who are unfortunate.‚Äù

original: rigs btsun par skye ba ni /
analyzed: rigs btsun par skye ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBeing born in a good family‚Äù means

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /üîΩbram ze rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am / bram ze rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu 'am /
translated: that some people are born in a greatüîΩnoble family,üîΩin a great brahmin family,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
translated: or in a great business family,

original: rigs gzhan yang gang phyug po rnams dang / nor mang ba rnams dang / longs spyod che ba rnams dang / nor rdzas mang ba rnams dang / bdag dbang ba mang zhing mtha' bzang ba rnams dang / nor dang 'bru dang bang mdzod mang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: rigs gzhan yang gang phyug po rnams dang / nor mang ba rnams dang / longs spyod che ba rnams dang / nor rdzas mang ba rnams dang / bdag dbang ba mang zhing mtha' bzang ba rnams dang / nor dang 'bru dang bang mdzod mang ba rnams dang /
translated: the wealthy, those with much wealth, those with great resources, those with many possessions, those with many servants, those with a good end, those with much wealth, grain, and treasuries,

original: de lta bu dag gi rigs su skye ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu dag gi rigs su skye ba lta bu yin te /
translated: those born into such families.

original: @100a * // de dag ni skal pa dang ldan pa'i mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @100a * // de dag ni skal pa dang ldan pa'i mi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called ‚Äúfortunate humans.‚Äù

original: rigs ngan pa yang ma yin rigs btsun pa yang ma yin par skye ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig de gnyi ga las ma gtogs pa'i bar ma'i rigs rnams su skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan pa yang ma yin rigs btsun pa yang ma yin par skye ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig de gnyi ga las ma gtogs pa'i bar ma'i rigs rnams su skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: Birth as neither low class nor high class is like that of some who are born into a middle class family, excluded from both of those.

original: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /

original: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / gzugs kyi khams na skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /üîΩso so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas par skye ba dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / gnas gtsang mar skye ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / gzugs kyi khams na skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas par skye ba dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / gnas gtsang mar skye ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of birth in the formless realm:

original: 'du shes tshad med pa'i lha rnams dang / ci yang med par 'du shes pa rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes tshad med pa'i lha rnams dang / ci yang med par 'du shes pa rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: birth among gods with immeasurable perception, birth among gods with no perception, and birth among gods with neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of bodies in the world should be understood as follows:

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na /
translated: in the limitless world systems of the ten directions,

original: sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the births of limitless sentient beings are limitless.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /üîΩrgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu gang yin pa de bas ni /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du / rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu gang yin pa de bas ni /
translated: The Blessed One has said this:üîΩ‚ÄúThe amount of blood that you have shed and lost while transmigrating and wandering for a long time

original: khyed yun ring po nas 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi khrag 'dzag cing 'bab pa ches mang ngo //
analyzed: khyed yun ring po nas 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi khrag 'dzag cing 'bab pa ches mang ngo //
translated: is much greater than the water in the four great oceans.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyed yun ring po nas glang po che rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skyes shing /
analyzed: khyed yun ring po nas glang po che rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skyes shing /
translated: For a long time you were born with the same fate as elephants,

original: rta rnams dang / rnga mo rnams dang / ba lang rnams dang / bong bu rnams dang / ra dang / ri dags dang / ma he dang / phag dang / khyi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skyes la /üîΩder khyed kyis yan lag dang nying lag bcad pa mang po nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: rta rnams dang / rnga mo rnams dang / ba lang rnams dang / bong bu rnams dang / ra dang / ri dags dang / ma he dang / phag dang / khyi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skyes la / der khyed kyis yan lag dang nying lag bcad pa mang po nyams su myong ste /
translated: horses, camels, oxen, donkeys, goats, deer, buffalo, pigs, and dogs.üîΩThere you experienced the cutting off of many limbs and appendages.

original: der khyed kyi khrag mang po zags shing 'bab par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der khyed kyi khrag mang po zags shing 'bab par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There you lost and shed much blood.

original: glang po che la sogs pa rnams dang skal pa mnyam par gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa rnams dang skal pa mnyam par gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as you were born with the same fate as elephants and so on,

original: mi rnams kyi nang du yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is the same for humans.

original: der khyed kyis pha'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / ma'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / phu nu po'i phyir @100b sdug bsngal ba dang / sring mo'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyen bshes zad pa dang / nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: der khyed kyis pha'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / ma'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / phu nu po'i phyir @100b sdug bsngal ba dang / sring mo'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyen bshes zad pa dang / nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ste /
translated: There you experience many sufferings for the sake of your father, for the sake of your mother, for the sake of your brother, for the sake of your sister, for the sake of your friends, for the sake of your relatives, for the sake of your wealth, for the sake of your possessions.

original: der khyed kyi mchi ma mang po zags shing bab par gyur to //
analyzed: der khyed kyi mchi ma mang po zags shing bab par gyur to //
translated: There you have shed many tears.

original: khrag dang mchi ma ji lta ba bzhin du ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khrag dang mchi ma ji lta ba bzhin du ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: You should look upon the milk you have drunk from your mother as equal to the blood and tears you have shed.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la ma nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o // de la ma nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: This is the classification of the suffering of birth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The suffering of uncertainty is stated by the BhagavƒÅn as follows:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the suffering of uncertainty?

original: dper na sa 'di'i steng na rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / lo ma gzhon nu ci yod pa de dag / skye bo rnams kyis sor bzhi tsam du dum bur bcad la /
analyzed: dper na sa 'di'i steng na rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / lo ma gzhon nu ci yod pa de dag / skye bo rnams kyis sor bzhi tsam du dum bur bcad la /
translated: For example, suppose that all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves on this earth were collected and divided into portions the size of a dice.

original: pha dang ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i phyir bkod de /
analyzed: pha dang ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i phyir bkod de /
translated: Then, having arranged them in a line, one after another, in the order of father and mother,

original: 'di ni bdag gi pha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi pha'o //

original: bdag gi pha de'i pha ni 'di'o //
analyzed: bdag gi pha de'i pha ni 'di'o //

original: 'di ni bdag gi ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi ma'o //
translated: This is my mother.

original: bdag gi ma de'i ma ni 'di'o zhes byas na /
analyzed: bdag gi ma de'i ma ni 'di'o zhes byas na /
translated: The mother of my mother is this one.‚Äù

original: sor bzhi tsam gyi dum bu de dag ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis ches myur du yongs su zad cing thug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sor bzhi tsam gyi dum bu de dag ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis ches myur du yongs su zad cing thug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this way, those portions the size of a dice would quickly be exhausted and come to an end.üîΩBut I do not say that the end of fathers and the end of mothers would come to an end.‚Äù

original: pha rnams kyi pha'i mtha' dang ma rnams kyi ma'i mtha' ni thug par 'gyur zhes nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang khyed kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba dang / mchog tu sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa gang dag mthong na /
analyzed: pha rnams kyi pha'i mtha' dang ma rnams kyi ma'i mtha' ni thug par 'gyur zhes nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang khyed kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba dang / mchog tu sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa gang dag mthong na /
translated: And: Whatever sentient beings you see who are suffering, who are in supreme suffering, who are miserable, who are in supreme misery, who are in despair, who are in supreme despair,

original: der khyed kyis bdag cag gis kyang 'di 'dra bar sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: der khyed kyis bdag cag gis kyang 'di 'dra bar sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: You should understand that we have experienced suffering and happiness in the same way that you have experienced suffering.

original: bde ba yang de dang 'dra bar nyams su myong ngo snyam du mtha' shes par gyis shig ces gsungs pa dang / sngon yun ring po 'das pa nas gang du khyed ma skyes pa dang / ma song ba dang / ma shi ba'i sa phyogs de ni ngas mthong bar dka'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang de dang 'dra bar nyams su myong ngo snyam du mtha' shes par gyis shig ces gsungs pa dang / sngon yun ring po 'das pa nas gang du khyed ma skyes pa dang / ma song ba dang / ma shi ba'i sa phyogs de ni ngas mthong bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult for me to see a place where you have not been born, have not gone, and have not died.

original: yun ring po 'das pa nas /üîΩsems can gang khyed kyi pha ma'am /
analyzed: yun ring po 'das pa nas / sems can gang khyed kyi pha ma'am /
translated: For a long time in the past,

original: phu nu 'am /üîΩsring mo'am // slob dpon nam /
analyzed: phu nu 'am / sring mo'am // slob dpon nam /
translated: it is difficult for me to see a sentient being who has not been your father,üîΩmother,üîΩbrother,üîΩsister,

original: mkhan po'am / bla ma'am /üîΩbla ma'i gnas lta bur ma gyur pa de ni ngas mthong bar dka'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang zag gcig gi bskal pa gcig gi rus pa rnams kyi rus pa'i phung po yang gal te sdud pa zhig yod la /
analyzed: mkhan po'am / bla ma'am / bla ma'i gnas lta bur ma gyur pa de ni ngas mthong bar dka'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang zag gcig gi bskal pa gcig gi rus pa rnams kyi rus pa'i phung po yang gal te sdud pa zhig yod la /
translated: teacher,

original: bsdus nas @101a * //
analyzed: bsdus nas @101a * //
translated: preceptor,üîΩor someone like a guru.

original: kyang gal te 'jig par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kyang gal te 'jig par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rul bar yang mi 'gyur du zin na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rul bar yang mi 'gyur du zin na 'di lta ste /
translated: if it were not to decay,

original: ri ngos yangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri ngos yangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: it would be as large as a mountain.

original: de la skye ba'i 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the process of birth?

original: 'di ltar lus rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the dependent origination of the body.

original: de ni de dag gi 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the process of birth.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / lus dang sgo dang don dang yang //
analyzed: sdom ni / lus dang sgo dang don dang yang //
translated: The body, the door, the object,

original: rnam par dbye dang rim pa bstan //
analyzed: rnam par dbye dang rim pa bstan //
translated: the analysis, the teaching of the stages,üîΩthe explanation of the words, the conditions,üîΩthe classification of the conditions,üîΩthe summary of the sutra,

original: nges pa'i tshig dang rkyen nyid dang // rkyen gyi rab tu dbye ba dang // mdo sde bsdu bar bya ba dang // mdo sde bsdu bar bya ba dang // rnam pa sna tshogs tha ma yin//
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang rkyen nyid dang // rkyen gyi rab tu dbye ba dang // mdo sde bsdu bar bya ba dang // mdo sde bsdu bar bya ba dang // rnam pa sna tshogs tha ma yin//
translated: and the various kinds are the last.

original: lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the body?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yin te /
translated: dependent origination is established in three ways:

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas ji ltar dbus kyi mthar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' nas ji ltar phyi ma'i mthar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mthar byung nas ji ltar gnas pa dang / rnam par byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas ji ltar dbus kyi mthar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' nas ji ltar phyi ma'i mthar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mthar byung nas ji ltar gnas pa dang / rnam par byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: How does it arise from the prior limit to the middle limit? How does it arise from the middle limit to the future limit? Having arisen in the middle limit, how does it endure? How does it cease?

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' nas ji ltar dbus kyi mthar 'byung zhing byung nas kyang dbus kyi mthar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' nas ji ltar dbus kyi mthar 'byung zhing byung nas kyang dbus kyi mthar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it arise from the prior limit to the middle limit and, having arisen, how does it endure in the middle limit?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni la la sngon mi mkhas shing ma rig par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni la la sngon mi mkhas shing ma rig par gyur pas /
translated: Thus, someone, previously unskilled and ignorant,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las byas shing bsags nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las byas shing bsags nas /
translated: having created and accumulated meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable karma of body, speech, and mind through the condition of ignorance,

original: de'i rnam par shes pa las de dang 'brel zhing nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa las de dang 'brel zhing nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: his consciousness becomes the cause of the consciousness that is connected with that and that links with the next existence.

original: nam ma shi ba'i dus kyi bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam ma shi ba'i dus kyi bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It continues until the time of death.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi sred pa yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi sred pa yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe /
translated: Craving for internal and external objects is the craving for the result of the action.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i grogs byed pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i grogs byed pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Craving for internal and external things also occurs in the way that it assists the consciousness that is the result of the process of actualization.

original: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas /
translated: When the consciousness of the intermediate state is about to enter the womb,

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi dus su rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa mthar gyis ma'i mngal du lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /üîΩmer mer po la sogs pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag gis /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi dus su rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa mthar gyis ma'i mngal du lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te / mer mer po la sogs pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag gis /
translated: the consciousness that is the result of the process of actualization, which is conditioned by the causal consciousness, is linked to a new existence at the very moment when the consciousness of the previous life ceases.üîΩThe consciousness of the intermediate state enters the womb and the name-and-form of the embryo develops in the womb.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i ming dang gzugs de gong nas gong du rga ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam par shes pa de @101b nyid nying mtshams sbyar ma thag tu skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i ming dang gzugs de gong nas gong du rga ba'i bar du 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa de @101b nyid nying mtshams sbyar ma thag tu skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de /
translated: The name-and-form of the embryo grows and develops in the womb through the different stages of the embryo, the fetus, and so on, until birth.

original: rnam par smin pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: The karma that is experienced immediately after birth ripens in the form of a result.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang ming dang gzugs de nyid la brten cing 'dug go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang ming dang gzugs de nyid la brten cing 'dug go //
translated: And that consciousness as retribution is supported on and occurs along with that name-and-form.

original: de yang rten rnam pa drug la brten cing 'dug ste /
analyzed: de yang rten rnam pa drug la brten cing 'dug ste /
translated: And that consciousness is supported on and occurs along with six bases.

original: des na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that name-and-form is a condition for the six consciousnesses.

original: lhan cig byung ba'i dbang po'i gzugs dang / 'gags ma thag pa'i ming ni ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug po dag gi rten yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byung ba'i dbang po'i gzugs dang / 'gags ma thag pa'i ming ni ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug po dag gi rten yin te /
translated: The simultaneous material sense-faculties and the immediately past name are the supports of the six consciousnesses, as appropriate.

original: de la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness occurs in dependence on them for as long as one lives.

original: dbang po gzugs can lnga po dag gi rten ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen pos bskyed pa'i gzugs dang dbang po rnams gang gis zin pa'i ming gang yin pa rgyud la yod pa'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can lnga po dag gi rten ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen pos bskyed pa'i gzugs dang dbang po rnams gang gis zin pa'i ming gang yin pa rgyud la yod pa'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ste /
translated: The supports of the five material sense-faculties are the great elements of the sense-faculties and the form derived from the great elements that support the sense-faculties. The name that is grasped by the continuity of the stream of consciousness that occurs in dependence on them is the support of the mental faculty.

original: de gnyi ga rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir gcig tu bsdus te rten yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir gcig tu bsdus te rten yin no //
translated: Since both of these are included in the one term, they are the basis.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Thus, it is said that consciousness is the condition of name-and-form,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and name-and-form is the condition of consciousness.

original: byung ba rnams kyang dbus kyi mthar 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: byung ba rnams kyang dbus kyi mthar 'jug pa ste /

original: de la mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'jug pa'i rim pa ni de yin no //üîΩsgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba ni ma'i mngal ma gtogs pa /

original: de las gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //

original: bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: bye brag ni de yod do //
